newsitem.title: FRANCE: Soc Gen, Iran banks sign finance accord.
newsitem.headline: Soc Gen, Iran banks sign finance accord.

text.p: Societe Generale said on Tuesday it has signed a $500 million trade financing agreement with five Iranian commercial banks.
Societe Generale signed the agreement in June with Bank Mellat, Bank Melli Iran, Bank Saderat Iran, Bank Sepah and Bank Tejarat, a spokeswoman for the French bank said.

"This agreement allows the setting up of loans insured by Coface for a period up to 10 years and which benefit from a guarantee from the Finance Ministry of the Islamic Republic of Iran," Societe Generale said in a statement.
The loans will finance exports of French goods.
Societe Generale said it also signed a framework agreement on 360-day refinancing of credits with Markazi Bank, to finance imports of essential products into Iran.
Societe Generale said it has been in Iran since 1974 and has a representative office in Teheran.

Banque Nationale de Paris said on February 27 it signed the first export financing accord with Iranian banks, totalling $500 million, since Coface resumed guarantees for Iran. Coface is the French state-owned export credit agency.
